intro: Carapichea verrucosa, commonly known as the rough carapichea, is a shrub native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that are often covered in fine hairs. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Carapichea verrucosa is adapted to grow in dry, open habitats and is often found in savannas and woodland areas.
